Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Plantaricin ASM1 (PASM1, Plantaricin A1; Plantaricin A-1; natural AMPs; 2S=S, UCSS1a; bacteriocin; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Narrow-spectrum active against L. plantarum JCM1057 (13.2 mm), L. pentosus JCM1558 (19.0 mm), L. curvatus JCM1096 (14.5 mm), L. lindneri JCM11027 (13.0 mm), L. mesenteroides  subsp. mesenteroides JCM6124 (17.2 mm), and E. faecalis NRIC1141 (18.0 mm). No inhibition zone for E.coli, S.aureus, S.typhimurium, L.monocytogenes, B.subtilis, B.cereus, L.lactis, L.brevis.Structure:  The structure is largely nonalphabeta.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structure bound to DPCherein the PDB.Peptide stability:heat-stable, pH-stable. Update 4/2016.Entry history:  The original entry Reutericin 6 has been merged with Gassericin A (AP766). Updated  3/2010; 7/2021; 11/2024 GW
Literature Information.Author: Hata T, Tanaka R, Ohmomo S.2010
Literature Information.Title: Isolation and characterization of plantaricin ASM1: a new bacteriocin produced by Lactobacillus plantarum A-1.
